definition: daughter-in-law/wife (of a younger man)/young married woman/young woman
to get oneself a wife/to take a daughter-in-law
young married woman/mistress/(fig.) punching bag/(old) child bride
erhua variant of 兒媳婦|儿媳妇[er2 xi2 fu5]
see 媳婦熬成婆|媳妇熬成婆[xi2 fu4 ao4 cheng2 po2]
pinyin: duo1 nian2 xi2 fu4 ao2 cheng2 po2

definition: lit. even a submissive daughter-in-law will one day become a domineering mother-in-law (idiom)/fig. the oppressed will become the oppressor/what goes around comes around
child bride/girl adopted into a family as future daughter-in-law
lit. the ugly daughter-in-law must sooner or later meet her parents-in-law (idiom)/fig. it's not something you can avoid forever
pinyin: chou3 xi2 fu4 zao3 wan3 ye3 dei3 jian4 gong1 po2
containing_words.word: 醜媳婦早晚也得見公婆

sentences.english: Third category called" little wife" middle, be a yes-man, like a doormat.
sentences.chinese: 第三類叫“小媳婦型”中層，唯唯諾諾，像個受氣包。

sentences.english: Mrs…has never really got on with her daughter-in-law.
sentences.chinese: 老太太從未與兒媳婦兒真正和睦相處過。

sentences.english: Son and daughter-indemnities to sell the house.
sentences.chinese: 兒子和媳婦認賠賣掉房子。

sentences.english: If your wife and your mother fall into the water at the same time, who will you save first?
sentences.chinese: 假如你媳婦和你媽同時掉進水裏，你先救誰？

sentences.english: But their wives probably have more reason to complain.
sentences.chinese: 而媳婦們可能有更多抱怨的理由。

sentences.english: Mr. Smith sometimes condescends to help his wife with the housework.
sentences.chinese: 史密斯先生有時屈尊幫他的媳婦做家務。

sentences.english: He dreams of the teaching job at Kabul University and of marrying a woman back home. She is the daughter of family friends a Sayed Shiite who traces her lineage to the prophet Muhammad.
sentences.chinese: 他夢想着在喀布爾大學任教，然後回老家娶媳婦。

sentences.english: Be attentive to the daughter or son in law.
Weekend with the wife to drive to the blue harbor two people walk around.
sentences.chinese: 週末跟媳婦兩個人開車去藍色港灣轉轉。

sentences.english: She failed in her obligations as a good daughter-in-law .
sentences.chinese: 她未做到一個好媳婦應盡的義務。

sentences.english: Most daughter-in-laws can get along with their mother-in-laws.
sentences.chinese: 大多數媳婦都能與婆婆和睦相處。

sentences.english: Because of Third Daughter-in-law's illness, Fang Tun-weng developed an interest in the study of family medicine.
sentences.chinese: 方遯翁爲了三媳婦的病，對家庭醫藥大起研究的興趣。

sentences.english: Since then no one dared to mention about "the bride of river god"any more.
sentences.chinese: 打那兒以後，誰也不敢再提給河伯娶媳婦的事了。

sentences.english: Unfortunately my Sichuan food turned out to be a fiasco.
sentences.chinese: 真不幸，我的四川特色菜在媳婦面前不戰自敗。

sentences.english: Life is like a shit-sandwich, everyday is another bite.
sentences.chinese: 媳婦兒像一陀大便，每個人都有另一陀。

sentences.english: Since then, the Handan area, it left a groom to marry the daughter-in-law to discredit custom face.
sentences.chinese: 自此，邯鄲一帶，便留下了新郎娶媳婦抹黑臉的風俗。

definition: a relative (i.e. family relation)/CL:門|门[men2],個|个[ge4],位[wei4]
to say again/to put off a discussion until later/moreover/what's more/besides

Sun Tzu, also known as Sun Wu 孫武|孙武[Sun1 Wu3] (c. 500 BC, dates of birth and death uncertain), general, strategist and philosopher of the Spring and Autumn Period (700-475 BC), believed to be the author of the “Art of War” 孫子兵法|孙子兵法[Sun1 zi3 Bing1 fa3], one of the Seven Military Classics of ancient China 武經七書|武经七书[Wu3 jing1 Qi1 shu1]
to answer/to respond/to answer positively/to agree/to accept/to promise
to come over/to manage/to handle/to be able to take care of
we or us (including both the speaker and the person(s) spoken to)/(dialect) I or me/(dialect) (in a coaxing or familiar way) you/also pr. [za2 men5]
